name: Flipbox
author: Arron Schaar, Daniel Buchner
description: Flips between two content elements with a CSS Animation, similar to flipping a playing card. The front face defaults to the first direct child element of the <x-flipbox>, and the back face defaults to the last direct child element.

attributes.direction: Indicates which direction the flip-animation swivels towards. Valid options are 'right', 'left', 'up', and 'down'. Defaults to 'left'.
attributes.flipped: Boolean attribute indicating whether the back face of the flipbox is showing or not.

setters.direction: The direction to flip. Valid values are right, left, up, and down.
setters.flipped: Set whether the back face of the flipbox is showing or not.

methods.toggle(): Flips the card to its opposite face.
methods.showFront(): Force the flipbox to flip to its front face.
methods.showBack(): Force the flipbox to flip to its back face.

events.flipend: The flipbox fires a flipend event whenever it fully finishes a flipping animation. This will not fire if the flipping animation is interrupted before completion.
events.show:
If either the front face or the back face of the flipbox receives a show event, the flipbox will automatically show that side. 
 Note: this event is not fired by the flipbox itself.
